avdta.network.node

Class StopSign

  • java.lang.Object
    • avdta.network.node.IntersectionControl
      • avdta.network.node.StopSign

  • public class StopSign
extends IntersectionControl
    This class represents a stop sign intersection control. Vehicles are delayed before they can enter the intersection, and capacity is adjusted based on straight and turning accelerations. Stop signs are modeled via a single conflict region that all turning movements pass through.

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove(Link i,
                       Link j,
                       DriverType driver)
        Returns whether a Vehicle of the specified DriverType can make the specified turning movement. All Vehicles should be able to move, regardless of the DriverType, because this is a stop sign.
        Specified by:
        canMove in class IntersectionControl
        Parameters:
        i - the incoming Link
        j - the outgoing Link
        driver - the DriverType
        Returns:
        whether a Vehicle of the specified DriverType can make the specified turning movement

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Initializes this StopSign after all data is read. This method updates the capacities based on expected accelerations from a stop.
        Specified by:
        initialize in class IntersectionControl

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets this StopSign to restart the simulation.
        Specified by:
        reset in class IntersectionControl

      • step

        public int step()
        Executes one time step of simulation. Vehicles that do not have a next Link (some buses) are removed from the network. Vehicles that move are removed from their previous Link (Link.removeVehicle(avdta.vehicle.Vehicle) and added to their next Link (Link.addVehicle(avdta.vehicle.Vehicle)). This requires that Vehicle.getPrevLink() is the incoming Link and Vehicle.getNextLink() is the outgoing Link.
        Specified by:
        step in class IntersectionControl
        Returns:
        the number of vehicles exiting

      • requires2Timesteps

        public boolean requires2Timesteps(Link i,
                                  Link j)
        Check whether a vehicle making the specified turning movement requires two time steps to complete it
        Parameters:
        i - the incoming Link
        j - the outgoing Link
        Returns:
        whether a vehicle making the specified turning movement requires two time steps to complete it

      • hasAvailableCapacity

        public boolean hasAvailableCapacity(Link i,
                                    Link j,
                                    double flow)
        Checks whether there is capacity remaining for the specified turning movement and equivalent flow.
        Parameters:
        i - the incoming Link
        j - the outgoing Link
        flow - equivalent flow of the vehicle. This may be reduced for autonomous vehicles due to lower following headways.
        Returns:
        whether a vehicle requiring the specified flow can make the specified turning movement

      • hasConflictRegions

        public boolean hasConflictRegions()
        Returns whether this intersection control uses conflict regions, which it does.
        Specified by:
        hasConflictRegions in class IntersectionControl
        Returns:
        true

      • getMinimumDelay

        public int getMinimumDelay(Link i)
        Returns the minimum delay for Vehicles on the specified incoming Link. This delay is based on the deceleration to a stop from the free flow speed. Vehicles wanting to traverse this StopSign must wait at least the specified delay before moving.
        Parameters:
        i - the incoming link
        Returns:
        the minimum delay
